title: Analysis Walkthrough Example
text:
We’ll start by loading. our libraries.


Code
library(tidyverse)


── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.1     ✔ readr     2.1.4
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0
✔ ggplot2   3.4.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.2     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.1     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors


Code
library(lubridate)


We’re going to look at some sample data from Texas on housing prices throughout the state.
First we’ll load data.


Code
# run this line below load the data for this assignment
# we'll use a built-in dataset from the ggplot2 package (loaded as party of the tidyverse)
housesales <- ggplot2::txhousing


Now, let’s see what the data looks like


Code
housesales %>% 
  head()


# A tibble: 6 × 9
  city     year month sales   volume median listings inventory  date
  <chr>   <int> <int> <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>
1 Abilene  2000     1    72  5380000  71400      701       6.3 2000 
2 Abilene  2000     2    98  6505000  58700      746       6.6 2000.
3 Abilene  2000     3   130  9285000  58100      784       6.8 2000.
4 Abilene  2000     4    98  9730000  68600      785       6.9 2000.
5 Abilene  2000     5   141 10590000  67300      794       6.8 2000.
6 Abilene  2000     6   156 13910000  66900      780       6.6 2000.

title: Ella Stern
text:
Hi, I’m Ella!
I’m a graduating senior at the George Washington University in Washington, DC. I like journalism, local politics and following cultural trends.
After graduation, I’m looking to pursue a career in strategic communications or public relations.

title: Ella Stern
text:
Education
School of Media and Public Affairs, George Washington University

title: Ella Stern
text:
Skills
Reporting and Writing
Media Monitoring
Strategic Communications
Media Relations
Data Analysis
Public Relations

title: Portfolio
text: Hi there this is my portfolio page!

title: Portfolio
section: How public interest communicators can engage youth advocates to advance urgent causes
text:
How public interest communicators can engage youth advocates to advance urgent causes
This is a blog post I wrote during my internship at Spitfire Strategies in the summer of 2022. The blog focuses on how professionals in the field of public interest communications can best support youth advocates.

title: Portfolio
section: GW must provide students with the means to succeed this fall
text:
GW must provide students with the means to succeed this fall
This is an op-ed that I wrote during in fall 2020 urging GW administrators to support students throughout the period of online learning, from Fall 2020-Spring 2021.

title: Portfolio
section: The CROWN Act and It’s Impact on Black Color at GW
text:
The CROWN Act and It’s Impact on Black Color at GW
This is a news package that I made for Broadcast News Reporting in Spring 2021. The package featured coverage of the recently passed CROWN Act and input from the GW community on its significance.
